content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 26.2 - Vehicles eligible for van pool plates

State Regulations
(a) Van pool operation. Only vehicles used in
a van pooling operation shall be eligible for van pool plates. Van pooling
means the prearranged transportation of persons to and from their places of
employment or other destination on a regular daily basis provided that any
monies paid by the passengers to the van pool vehicle owner, lessee or operator
are solely for the recovery of some or all expenses related directly to the
transport of the passengers, including tolls, fuel, insurance and depreciation
on a not-for-profit basis. (b) Vehicle size. Only vehicles which have an adult seating capacity of not less
than six and not more than fifteen passengers in addition to the driver may
qualify for van pool plates. Ordinary passenger vehicles will not qualify for
van pool plates. Suburban (station wagon) type vehicles will qualify for van
pool plates only if such vehicle is equipped with enough seats to accommodate
not less than six and not more than fifteen passengers. (c) Vehicles may not operate under the New

York City Taxi and Limousine Commission or Department of Transportation
certification. A vehicle will not be qualified for van pool plates if it is
operating pursuant to any authority of the New York City Taxi and Limousine

Commission and/or has a currently valid certificate as a common carrier or a
currently valid permit issued by the New York State Department of

Transportation. Notes
